title: Cold War Events Quiz
description: Test your recall of the pivotal events during the Cold War era!

questions.question: In what year did the Berlin Wall fall?
questions.explanation: The Berlin Wall fell on November 9, 1989, symbolizing the end of the Cold War and the beginning of German reunification.

questions.question: What was the 1962 standoff over Soviet missiles in Cuba called?
questions.explanation: The Cuban Missile Crisis in October 1962 was a 13-day confrontation between the US and Soviet Union over nuclear missiles placed in Cuba.

questions.question: Which airlift supplied West Berlin when the Soviets blockaded the city in 1948-1949?
options: All of these names were used
questions.explanation: The Berlin Airlift was known by all these names -- Operation Vittles (US), Operation Plainfare (UK), and commonly as the Berlin Airlift.

questions.question: Which country's invasion by the Soviet Union in 1979 became known as 'Russia's Vietnam'?
questions.explanation: The Soviet Union invaded Afghanistan in 1979, beginning a devastating decade-long war that contributed to the Soviet Union's eventual collapse.

questions.question: What doctrine pledged US support for countries resisting communist expansion?
questions.explanation: The Truman Doctrine, announced in 1947, pledged US support for countries threatened by Soviet communism, starting with Greece and Turkey.

questions.question: What was the name of the US plan to rebuild Western Europe after WWII?
questions.explanation: The Marshall Plan (1948-1952) provided over $13 billion in economic aid to help rebuild Western European economies after World War II.

questions.question: Which 1950s event saw Senator Joseph McCarthy lead a campaign against alleged communists?
questions.explanation: McCarthyism refers to Senator Joseph McCarthy's campaign of accusations and investigations against alleged communists in the US government during the 1950s.

questions.question: In what year was NATO (North Atlantic Treaty Organization) founded?
questions.explanation: NATO was founded on April 4, 1949, as a collective defense alliance among Western nations against potential Soviet aggression.

questions.question: Which Soviet leader initiated the policies of glasnost and perestroika?
questions.explanation: Mikhail Gorbachev introduced glasnost (openness) and perestroika (restructuring) in the mid-1980s, reforms that ultimately led to the end of the Soviet Union.

questions.question: What was the failed 1961 CIA-sponsored invasion of Cuba called?
questions.explanation: The Bay of Pigs invasion in April 1961 was a failed attempt by CIA-trained Cuban exiles to overthrow Fidel Castro's government.

questions.question: Which event saw Soviet tanks crush a pro-democracy uprising in 1956?
questions.explanation: The Hungarian Revolution of 1956 was a nationwide revolt against the Soviet-imposed government, brutally suppressed by Soviet tanks and troops.

questions.question: What year did the Soviet Union officially dissolve?
questions.explanation: The Soviet Union officially dissolved on December 26, 1991, ending nearly 70 years of communist rule and the Cold War era.

questions.question: Which speech by Winston Churchill popularized the term 'Iron Curtain'?
questions.explanation: Churchill delivered his famous 'Iron Curtain' speech on March 5, 1946, at Westminster College in Fulton, Missouri.

questions.question: What was the Soviet response to NATO, formed in 1955?
questions.explanation: The Warsaw Pact was a collective defense treaty among the Soviet Union and seven Eastern European satellite states, established in 1955.

questions.question: Which U-2 spy plane pilot was shot down over the Soviet Union in 1960?
questions.explanation: Francis Gary Powers was shot down over Soviet territory on May 1, 1960, causing a major diplomatic incident between the US and USSR.
